INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of excessive bradycardia (addition of the effects)
Increase of the bradycardia inducing effects which can have fatal consequences. The beta-blocking agents are even more at risk since they inhibit the adrenergic compensation mechanisms
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and sustained EKG during the 24 hours following the first dose.

CLASS.name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administration of these together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of pulmonary toxicity
Increase of the concentrations of the active metabolite of the brentuximab, with risk of neutropenia
Risk of increase or decrease of the effects of the buprenorphine, due to simultaneous inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
With the buprenorphine used in opioid replacement therapy: increased risk of respiratory depression which could be fatal.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Evaluate carefully the risk/benefits relationship of administering these substances together. Inform the patient of the necessity of adhering to the prescribed dosages.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase or of decrease of the effects of the A to take into account buprenorphine [sic], simultaneously by inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
Risk of increase or decrease of the effects of the buprenorphine, due to both inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buprenorphine during the treatment with the inhibitor and, if the situation requires, after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buprenorphine during the treatment with the inhibitor and, if the situation requires, after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the cloripramine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the clomipramine during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the desipramine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the desipramine during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypertensive crises
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
With the metoprolol used for heart failure: risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the bupropion

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the nortriptyline due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the nortriptyline during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the terbinafine [sic]

Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tramadol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion. In addition, risk of convulsions due to addition of the effects of the two medications
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the bupropion, with increase of its active metabolite and increased toxicity
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the buspirone
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem, with increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with substantial increase of sedation
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with substantial increase of sedation
Rick of increase of the undesirable effects of the buspirone due to decrease of its metabolism by the grapefruit
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone during the treatment with rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil, with increase of its undesirable effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the busulfan due to decrease of its clearance by the deferasirox
With the busulfan in large doses: doubling of the concentrations of busulfan by the itraconazole
With the busulfan in large doses: doubling of the concentrations of busulfan by the metronidazole
Decrease of the concentrations of the cytotoxic by increase of its metabolism by the inducer, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the undesirable dose dependent effects of the cabazitaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzymatic inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the cabazitaxel during the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of caffeine, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the caffeine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Interrupt a caffeine based treatment at least 5 days before myocardial perfusion imaging with the dipyridamole and avoid consumption of coffee, tea, chocolate, or cola during the 24 hours that precede the test.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of caffeine, which can lead to agitation and hallucinations, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
In case of sudden discontinuation of consumption of coffee or of medications containing caffeine, risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of lithium
Increase of the plasma concentrations of caffeine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the mexiletine
Increase of the plasma concentrations of caffeine, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the caffeine
Possible increase of the plasma concentrations of the caffeine, with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of caffeine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the calcitonin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For the calcium salts administered via oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the bisphosphonates
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take calcium salts and antacids at a different time from the bisphosphonates (from 30 minutes minimum to more than 2 hours apart, if possible, depending on the bisphosphonate).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of serious arrhythmias, even lethal ones, with the calcium salts administered by IV route.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the calcium salts via IV, except for parenteral supplementation

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypercalcemia due to decrease of the urinary elimination of the calcium.
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the estramustine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the estramustine (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the iron salts by oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the iron salts
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from meals and in the absence of calcium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the absorption of the thyroid hormones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the thyroid hormones (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the calcium salts administered by oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the strontium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the strontium at a different time from the calcium salts (more than two hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the zinc by the calcium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the zinc (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Stop the treatment with the HMG-COA Reductase Inhibitor before starting a treatment with fusidic acid or use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fusidic acid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the therapy with ombitasvir+paritaprevir
Risk of increase of serious infections
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and possible reduction of its dosage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: at the beginning of treatment, increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine, especially during the first days of treatment with the cimetidine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the carbamazepine. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of the clonazepam due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinincal monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosages of the two anticonvulsants

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the serious hematological effects
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine, with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and decrease of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Exercise caution in the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of symptomatic hyponatremia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring. If possible, use another class of diuretics.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ethosuximide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosage of the ethosuximide and possible increase of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the carbamazepine. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of felbamate due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosages of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of fluconazole >=200 mg per day: possible increase of the undesirable effects of the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of carbamazepine, during the antifungal treatmentand after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine, and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine, and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and. if needed, plasma dosage and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the neurological effects (vertigo, ataxia, diplopia) of the carbamazepine when the lamotrigine is introduced
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of neurotoxicity manifesting as disorders of the cerebellum, confusion, drowsiness, ataxia. These disorders are reversible when the treatment with the lithium is stopped.
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the carbamazepine
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to decrease of its absorption by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the olanzapine and of its therapeutic effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the olanzapine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine, with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the grapefruit
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Progressive decrease of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and of its active metabolite without apparent modification of its anticonvulsive effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use prudence with respect to the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal reduction of the plasma concentrations (increase of the metabolism without apparent modification of the anticonvulsive effectiveness)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use prudence in the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the carbamazepine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations, and adjustment of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the refampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the active fraction of the risperidone and of its therapeutic effectiveness due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the risperidone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of simvastatin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Decrease of the concentrations of the topiramate with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the topiramate during the treatment with the carbamazepine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the carbamazepine with signs of overdose. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of valproic acid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and adjustment of the dosage of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increased bone marrow toxicity (inhibition of the metabolism of the carmustine)

With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the concentrations of the carvedilol, which can be dangerous in the case of treatment for heart failure due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another gastric H2 receptor antagonist.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the carvedilol, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the carvedilol during the treatment with the rifampicin. When the rifampicin is stopped, risk of large increase of the plasma concentrations of carvedilol imposing a reduction of the dosage and strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the resin administered by oral and rectal routes: risk of colonic necrosis, possibly fatal
With the resin administered by oral and rectal routes: risk of colonic necrosis, possibly fatal
Increase of the nephrotoxicity of the aminoglycosides by the cefalotin is under discussion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of renal function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cephalosporin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cephalosporin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cephalosporin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of rash, redness, and heat linked to an increase of the vasodilator effect
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cephalosporin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: accrued risk of drowsiness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Warn patients of the increase of risk when driving an automobile or using machinery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after the chloroquine is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Slowing of the elimination of the chloroquine and risk of overdose
Risk of clinical hypothyroidism in patients taking thyroid hormones in substitution therapy
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormone during the treatment with the antimalarial and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With strong doses (100 mg per day of chlorpromazine): elevation of glycemia (decrease of the freeing of insulin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self monitoring of blood glucose. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the neuroleptic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With strong doses (100 mg per day of chlorpromazine): elevation of glycemia (decrease of the freeing of insulin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self monitoring of blood glucose. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the neuroleptic during the treatment and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of variation of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the ciclosporin be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours away from the administration of the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase by nearly 5 times of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Doubling of the concentrations of ambrisentan, with increase of the vasodilator effect (severe headaches )
Larger increase of the creatinemia than with ciclosporin alone, with increase of the nephrotoxic risk
Increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of nephrotoxic effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of the ciclosporin during the treatment with the amiodarone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the amphotericin B administered by IV route: greater increase of the creatinemia than with ciclosporin alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances)

With the ciclosporin administered orally:
reduction of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin (decrease of its intestinal absorption).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase of the doses of ciclosporin according to testing of the plasma concentrations and reduction of the dosage after the treatment with the somatostatin analog is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the nephrotoxic effects, especially with older patients.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor renal function at the beginning of the treatment with the NSAI.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the intestinal absorption of the cholesterol lowering medication)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 10mg/day of atorvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached at that dosage, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the two substances together and after the macrolide is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin and increase of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after the chloroquine is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
Decrease of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant with risk of loss of immunosuppressive activity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce testing of the blood dosages of ciclosporin and possible increase of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the undesirable neuromuscular effects and increase of the toxicity of the colchicine with risk of overdose due to inhibition of its elimination by the ciclosporin, especially in cases of pre-existing renal insufficiency
Increase by more than double of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)

Risk of increase of the creatinemia without modification of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin, even in the absence of fluid depletion. Also risk of hyperuricemia and of complications such as gout
Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the ciclosporin
Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus by the ciclosporin. The nephrotoxicity of the ciclosprorin is also increased when the two medications are administered together
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the everolimus, possibly adjustment of the dosage, and testing of the renal function during the administration of the two together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For one thing, increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to increase of the concentrations of ezetimibe; for another thing, possible increase of the concentrations of ciclosporin
Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity of the ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring of the renal function during and after the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin.
Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of these medications together and after the macrolide is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant and larger increase of the concentrations of the lercanidipine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Separate the administration of the two medications. Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment if necessary of its dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate and of the ciclosporin with increase of the creatinemia: reciprocal decrease of the clearances of the two medications
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of ciclosporin and of methotrexate. Adjustment of the dosage if necessary during the administration of the two together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the methylprednisolone administered by IV route: possible increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia. Mecanism proposed: decrease of the hepatic elimination of the ciclosporin
Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after the macrolide is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the blood concentrations and of the effectiveness of the immunosuppressant
Risk of addition of undesirable effects of the gum disorders type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another dihydropyridine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of there substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin due to decrease of its intestinal absorption, with risk of loss of the immunosuppressive activity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the orlistat at a different time form the ciclosporin (at least 3 hours apart). Reinforce testing of blood dosages of the ciclosporin, especially at the beginning of the administration of the medications together, and at the time of a possible increase in the dosage of the orlistat.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, or of nephrotoxicity, due to decrease of the metabolism of the pitavastatin
Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid the administration of these two substances together unless there is pre-existing hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the prednisolone: characteristic Cushings appearance, reduction of tolerance of carbohydrates (decrease of clearance of the prednisolone)
Increase of more than double of the concentrations of the repaglinide due to increase of its absorption
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, or of nephrotoxicity, due to decrease of the metabolism of the rosuvastatin
Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration with the macrolide and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabdomyolosis type due to decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin
Increase of the blood concentrations of sirolimus by the ciclosporin. The nephrotoxicity of the ciclosporin is also increased when the two medications are administered together
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the sirolimus be administered 4 hours after the cyclosporine. Testing of the renal function, during the administration of the two medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin due to increase of its metabolism by the sulfinpyrazone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with sulfinpyrazone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of administration with the ciclosporin, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with terbinafine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase of the dosage of the ciclosporin according to testing of the blood concentrations. Reduction of the dosage when the ticlodipine is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the trimethoprim (alone or in combination) by oral route: increase of the creatinemia with possible decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
With the trimethoprim (alone or in combination) by IV route: the decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin can be very large, with possible loss of immunosuppressant capacity
Increase of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin (decrease of its hepatic metabolism), and increase of the risk of gum disorders
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800mg/day: increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the cimetidine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage (decrease of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cimetidine and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: at the beginning of treatment, increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine, especially during the first days of treatment with the cimetidine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increased bone marrow toxicity (inhibition of the metabolism of the carmustine)

With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the concentrations of the carvedilol, which can be dangerous in the case of treatment for heart failure due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another H2 receptor antagonist.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cemitidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: accrued risk of drowsiness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Warn patients of the increase of risk when driving an automobile or using machinery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Slowing of the elimination of the chloroquine and risk of overdose
With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increased risk of drowsiness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Warn the patient of the increase of risk when driving an automobile or using machinery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with risk of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increased bone marrow toxicity (inhibition of the metabolism of the lomustine)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of methadone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical and electrocardiographic monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the metoprolol used for heart failure, and the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the concentrations of the metoprolol, which can be dangerous in the case of treatment for heart failure, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetadine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the cimetidine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the concentrations of the moclobemide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring with possible adjustment of the dosage of moclobemide

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the hypotensive effect of the nifedipine due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring: adjust the dosage of the nifedipine during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with possibility of appearance of the usual signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring, plasma concentration dosages of the phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the metabolism of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the theophylline during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the plasma concentrations of dextromethorphan with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecanaide with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of metoprolol with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with the cinacalcet and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of caffeine, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Increase of the concentrations of clozapine with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ciprofloxacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the ciprofloxacin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate due to inhibition of its renal tubular secretion by the ciprofloxacin
Variation, possibly large, of the concentrations of phenytoin in the case of treatment with ciprofloxacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of the anticonvulsant during the treatment with ciprofloxacin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ropinirole with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ciprofloxacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the ropinirole during the treatment with the ciprofloxacin and after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrythmias, especially of torsades de pointes.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ciprofloxacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of facilitation of systemic uptake of the aluminum, especially in case of altered renal function.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the aluminum based gastrointestinal medications at a different time (more than 2 hours apart if possible) from the citrates, including natural citrates (citrus fruit juices).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cladribine by the lamivudine
Risk of variation of blood concentrations of ciclosporin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of clarithyromycin and inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering agent. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with clarithromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed subjects (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the clarithromycin.
In the treatment of infections with Mycobacterium avium complex, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the clarithromycin due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the etravirine
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of the clarithromycin and of its active metabolite due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the linezolide by the clarithromycin due to increase of its absorption
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the medication tending to induce torsades de pointes. If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT before hand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentration of the pravastatin by the clarithromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring during the treatment with the antibiotic

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the plasma concentrations of the repaglinide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the hypoglycemic agent during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis) due to increase of its concentrations and those of its active metabolite by the clarithromycin. In addition, increase of the metabolism of the clarithromycin by the rifabutin, with increase of the concentrations of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and risk of lower effectiveness of the clarithromycin, especially with the HIV patient, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (contentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent

CLASS.name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de points
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administration of these medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the theophyllinemia, particularly with children
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the clarithromycin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical and biological monitoring. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the clindamycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant with risk of loss of immunosuppressive activity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforced testing of the blood dosages of ciclosporin and possible increase of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant with risk of loss of immunosuppressive activity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforced testing of the blood dosages of tacrolimus and possible increase of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of these anticonvulsants, with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of their hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosage, when that is possible, of the anticonvulsant taken with the stiripentol and possible adjustment of the dosage of the anticonvulsant taken with it as well.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the clomipramine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the clomipramine during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the carbamazepine. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of the clonazepam due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosages of the two anticonvulsants

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Described for desipramine, imipramine:
inhibition of the antihypertensive effect of the clonidine (antagonism at the level of the adrenergic receptors)
Disorders of autoregulation (disorders of atrioventricular conduction due to addition of the negative effects on conduction)
Disorders of autoregulation (disorders of atrioventricular conduction due to addition of the negative effects on conduction)
Possible inhibition of the antihypertensive activity due to antagonism at the level of the receptors
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to addition of the platelet antiagregation action
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -aside from validated indications for this combination of drugs in acute coronary syndromes.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of the paclitaxel by the clopidogrel, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose (inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of the repaglinide by the clopidogrel, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects.
Accrued risk of drop in blood pressure with respiratory and/or cardiac arrest.
Risk of increase of the serious hematological effects
Increase of the concentrations of clozapine with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ciprofloxacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the ciprofloxacin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of clozapine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ineffectiveness of the antipsychotic treatment (decrease of the plasma concentrations of clozapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ineffectiveness of the antipsychotic treatment (decrease of the plasma concentrations of clozapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the amiodarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cobicistat due to the increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Risk of increase of the plasma concentratons of the cobicistat or of the inhibitor of CYP3A4
INTERACTION.COMMENT: To know the risks and levels of severity of each interaction, consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) of each medication.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the cobicistat
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together. Large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day) are not recommended.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cobicistat due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinidine due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Very large increase of the metabolite of the rifabutin, with risk of increase of its toxicity (uveitis, neutropenia). Furthermore, possible decrease of the concentrations of cobicistat
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjustment of the dosage of the rifabutin (in principle, reduction of the doses by half).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cobicistat due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
With the atazanavir, the darunavir or the lopinavir boosted by cobicistat, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of administration of these together, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day. The combination with the other protease inhibitors of HIV has not been studied.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cobicistat
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of cocaine due to decrease of its metabolism by the disulfiram, with increased risk of torsades de pointes

With women of child bearing age, risk of transformation of the acitretin into etretinate, a powerful agent of birth defects and malformations with a very prolonged half life (120 days), exposing the woman to a major risk of these birth defects and malformations of the child in case of pregnancy, during the treatment and two months after it ends.
Risk of increase of the hepatotoxicity of the methotrexate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together is judged necessary, strengthen liver function testing.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the colchicine and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the undesirable neuromuscular effects and increase of the toxicity of the colchicine with risk of overdose due to inhibition of its elimination by the ciclosporin, espceially in cases of pre-existing renal insufficiency
Risk of increase of the undesirable muscular effects of these substances, and especially of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, particularly at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Risk of increase of the undesirable muscular effects of these substances, and especially of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the macrolides

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Increase od the plasma concentrations of the colchicine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the therapy with ombitasvir + paritaprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with patients having renal and/or hepatic insufficiency

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, due to increase of its plasma concentrations by the verapamil
Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarization at the end of anesthesia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarization at the end of anesthesia

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of the curarization at the end of anesthesia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarisation at the end of anesthesia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarisation at the end of anesthesia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of these molecules due to decrease of their metabolism and/or increase of their bioavailability by the crizotinib
With the glucocorticoids by IV route: risk of severe myopathy, reversible after a possibly long period (several months).
Risk of deficiency of cyanocobalamin after prolonged treatment (several years), the reduction of gastric acidity by these medications can diminish the digestive absorption of the vitamin B12
Risk of deficiency of cyanocobalamin after prolonged treatment (several years), the reduction of gastric acidity by these medications can diminish the digestive absorption of the vitamin B12.
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the tetracycline antibiotic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotic (more than two hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the tetracycline antibiotics administered by oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics (formation of complexes)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of intracranial hypertension
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the strontium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the strontium at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than two hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In case of intake of 10,000 IU/day and more: risk of intracranial hypertension
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of pulmonary toxicity which could be fatal
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the antidepressant
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of cyproterone with risk of lower contraceptive effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In its use as a hormonal contraceptive:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyproterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In its indications as an anti-androgen, clinical monitoring and if possible adjustment of the dosage of the cyproterone during the administration with the bosentan and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyproterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -when used as a hormonal contraceptive: use of another method of contraception in particular a barrier type, is preferred during the length of the administration of these substances together and a cycle following

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyproterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in its use as a hormonal contraceptive: use instead another method of contraception in particular a barrier type, during the length of the administration of these substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyproterone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns Wort
For doses of perampenel >or = to 12 mg/day, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyproterone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In its use as a hormonal contraceptive: use instead another method of contraception in particular a barrier type, during the length of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of antagonism of the effects of the progestin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not take a progestin treatment fewer than 12 hours after the ulipristal is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less than 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg per hour for an adult.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less than 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg in an hour for an adult.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less than 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg in an hour for an adult.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less than 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg in an hour for an adult.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of thrombosis and hemorrhage accompanying tumors. In addition, possible interaction between the vitamin K antagonist and the chemotherapy
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Excessive immunodepression with risk of lymphoproliferative syndrome

Risk of onset of convulsions due to decrease of the digestive absorption of the phenytoin only by the cytotoxic, or risk of increase of the toxicity or loss of effectiveness of the cytotoxic due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin or the fosphenytoin
Risk of general vaccine disease, possibly fatal
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --and during the 6 months following the end of the chemotherapy

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: For post surgical indications:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Increase of more than double the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Doubling of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of more than double the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of more than double the plasma concentrations of dabagitan, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150 mg/day in one dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150mg/day in one dose, or even 75mg/day in case of moderate renal insufficiency.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dacarbazine in large doses: risk of pulmonary toxicity (adult respiratory distress syndrome).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not use these medications simultaneously, but wait a week between the last administration of fotemustine and the first day of the treatment with dacarbazine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Only in the combination daclatasvir/sofosbuvir:
Possibly abrupt onset of bradycardia, that can have fatal consequences
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with thedaclatasvir/sofosbuvir combination

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dexamethasone for systemic use, risk of significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of daclatasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the exception of the dexamethasone administered in a single dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of daclatasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with rifampicin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of daclatasvir by the inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of daclatasvir must be decreased to 30 mg 1 time per day in case of administration with the inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of daclatasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns Wort
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with these medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes.
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to the direct effect on coagulation and/or the fibrinolytic systems.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type due to decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin
Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the antidiabetic during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus and adjustment of its dosage during the administration of it with the danazol and after it is stopped, with testing of the renal function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dantrolene administered via IV: cases of fatal ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed in animals when verapamil and dantrolene are administered via IV. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident

With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident

With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo or fainting type

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo and fainting type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the type 5 phosphodiesterase inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent CBC

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, reinforce biological monitoring (CPK levels more than once a week) and strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommendedthat the amiodarone be administered as great a distance from the afatanib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or of 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its metabolisn by these substances
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together and 1 to 2 weeks after they are stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommendedthat the ciclosporin be administered as great a distance from the afatanib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or of 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the erythromycin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the erythromycin be administered as great a distance from the afatanib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or of 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the protease inhibiter.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the protease inhibitor be administered as great a distance from the afatanib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or of 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the itraconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the itraconazole be administered as great a distance from the afatanib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or of 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the ketoconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the ketoconazole be administered as great a distance from the afatanib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or of 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the afatinib due to the increase of its metabolism by the primidone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together and 1 to 2 weeks after they are stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the afatinib due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together and 1 to 2 weeks after they are stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the verapamil.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the verapamil be administered as great a distance from the afatanib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or of 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of felcainide, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the metoprolol, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hepatoxicity
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the dasabuvir by the gemfibrozil
Risk of reduction of the plasma concentrations of the dasabuvir by the inducer.

Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of deferasirox
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the ferritinemia during and after the treatment with the enzymatic inducer. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of deferasirox.

Increase of the risk of causing ulcers and digestive hemorrhage
Risk of increase of the toxocity of the bufulfan by decrease of its clearance by the deferasirox.
Risk of hyperchelation
Risk of hyperchelation
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the deferasirox
