INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the ferritinemia during and after the treatment with the enzymatic inducer. If needed, adjust the dosage of deferasirox.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperchelation

With large doses of the ascorbic acid and by intravenous route:
cardiac function anomalies, even acute heart failure (generally reversible by ending administration of the Vitamin C).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of hemochromatosis, only give Vitamin C after having started treatment with the deferoxamine. Monitor cardiac function when these substances are administered together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperchelation
Increased risk of hemorrhage
Increased risk of hemorrhage.
Increased risk of hemorrhage.
Increased risk of hemorrhage.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations de delamanid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of delamanid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

Risk of increase of the myelosuppression effect of the immunomodulator by inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the ASA derivative, especially with patients presenting a partial deficit of thiopurine methyltransferase (TMPT)
Risk of significant hypotension (synergic effect) capable of aggravating the state of myocardial ischemia and especially provoking an acute coronary accident
Increase of the risk of hypotension, especially orthostatic.
Risk of significant hypotension (synergic effect).
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the desipramine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the desipramine during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects.
Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects.
Decrease of the effectiveness of the dexamethasone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjustment of the dosage of the dexamethasone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
With the dexamethasone for systemic use, risk of significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of daclatasvir due to increase of it hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the exception of dexamethasone administered in a single dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantel, with risk of failure of the treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the praziquantel by the dexamethasone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Separate the administration of the two medications by at least a week.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dexmethasone for systemic use, risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of rilpivirine due to increase of its hepatic metaolism by the dexamethasone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the exception of dexamethasone administered in a single dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dexmethasone for systemic use, risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of simeprevir by increase of its hepatic metabolism by the dexamethasone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the exception of dexamethasone administered in a single dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome

CLASS.name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function by the dextran 40)

CLASS.name: UNFRACTIONATED HEPARIN (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function by the dextran 40)
Very large increase of the plasma concentrations of dextromethorphan with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the buspirone
With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: accrued risk of drowsiness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Warn the patients of the increase of risk when driving an automobile or using machinery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Unpredictable variations: the plasma concentrations of phenytoin can increase, with signs of overdose, but also decrease or remain stable.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the diazepam, with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and plasma dosage, when that is possible, of the anticonvulsant taken with the stiripentol and possible adjustment of the dosage of the anticonvulsant taken with it as well.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of didanosine and of its undesirable effects

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the didanosine, and especially the mitochondrial toxicity, due to substantial increase of its concentrations. In addition, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ganciclovir due to decrease of its concentrations, if the two medications are ingested in an interval of less than 2 hours
Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the blood amylase level. Do not use these two medications together if the blood amylase level is at the high range of normal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the mitochrondrial toxicity of the didanosine due to increase of its active metabolite
Risk of failure of the antiretroviral treatment, even emergence of resistance. In addition, increase of the risk of the mitchondrial toxicity of the didanosine
Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis and of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and monitoring of the amylasemia. Do not administer these substances together if the amylasemia is at the high range of normal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Depression of self-regulation (excessive bradycardia) and difficulties with atrioventricular conduction. In addition, increase of the digoninemia due to decrease of the clearance of digoxin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, if there is reason for it, testing of the digoxinemia and adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during treatment with the azithromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Difficulties with autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest) and difficulties with sinoauricular and atrioventricular conduction
Risk of serious arrhythmias, even lethal ones with the calcium salts administered via IV
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the calcium salts by IV route, except for parenteral supplementation.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and decrease of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Exercise caution in the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with the clarithromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Depression of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia) and disorders of atrioventricular conduction. In addition, increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the metabolism of the digoxin. Clinical monitoring and EKG.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the doses of digoxin by half.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with the erythromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of unexpected results, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Hypokaliemia producing toxic effects of the digitalics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Correct beforehand all hypokaliemia and do clinical, electrolytic, and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia, more marked for IV route, due to increase of the absorption of the digoxin or decrease of its renal clearance.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with possible adjustment of the dosage of digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG, and monitoring of the digoxinemia with adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the itraconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Difficulties with autoregulation (increase of the bradycardia inducing effect of the midodrine) and difficulties with atrioventricular conduction.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this combination cannot be avoided, reinforce clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digoxinemia, by reason of the enzyme inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (acute decompensated heart failure).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of the two substances being taken together by accident, do not stop the St Johns wort abruptly, but test the plasma concentrations (or the effectiveness) of the digoxin before and then after the St Johns wort is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption by the omeprazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and monitoring of the digoxinemia, particularly with an older patient.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with adjustment of the dosage of the digxoin during the treatment with the posaconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the digoxinemia, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with propafenone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of an unexpected result, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if needed, with possible adjustment of the doses of digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical, biological, and possibly EKG monitoring. Adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin if needed.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the digoxin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the digoxin (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digoxinemia that can reach 50%
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the sulfasalazine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the telaprevir and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with the telithromycin and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Excessive bradycardia and atrioventricular block due to increase of the effects of the digoxin on autoregulation and conduction and due to decrease of the renal and extra-renal elimination of the digoxin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, testing of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the verapamil and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic elimination of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic elimination of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and the dose of the medication derived from ergot of rye, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).

Hypotension, heart failure with patients having latent or uncontrolled cardiac insufficiency (addition of the negative inotropic effects). The beta blocking agent can furthermore minimize the sympathetic reflex reaction brought into play in the case of excessive hemodynamic repercussion

Hypotension, heart failure in patients with latent or uncontrolled cardiac insufficiency (negative inotropic effect of the dihydropyridines in vitro, more or less marked, and susceptible of adding to the negative inotropic effects of the beta blocking agents). The presence of a beta-blocking treatment can furthermore minimize the sympathetic reflex reaction put into play in cases of excessive hemodynamic repercussion.

With the dantrolene administered via IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered via IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident.
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when there is treatment with the diltiazem.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For diltiazem by injection: risk of bradycardia and of atrioventricular block
For diltiazem by mouth: risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially in older persons.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with diltiazem administered intravenously

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering agent or another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The administration of these medications together should only be done under strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure, disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest), and disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem, with increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (disorders of atrioventricular conduction due to addition of the negative effects on conduction)

With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantolene together without incident
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).

Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Begin the treatment with the calcium channel blocker at the minimum recommended dosages and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac arrest.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in case of alteration of left ventricular function

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg/day during the length of time that these medications are administered together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with these medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage during the treatment with the diltiazem

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the concentrations of nefidipine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem, with risk of severe hypotension
Increase of the plasma concentrations of olaparib by the diltiazem
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 200 mg twice a day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20 mg/day of simvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached at this dosage, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolsim
Possible increase of the risk of infection
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of lower effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzyme inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the ritonavir, with risk of lower effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzyme inducer [sic] and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of lower effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzyme inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of overdose due to increase of the plasma concentrations of diprophylline (inhibition of its renal tubular secretion)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dosage of diprophylline during the treatment with the probenicid

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the theine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid the consumption of theine based products during the 24 hours before myocardial perfusion imaging with dipyridamole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dipyridamole by injection: increase of the antihypertensive effect
With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the caffeine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Interrupt a caffeine based treatment at least 5 days before myocardial perfusion imaging with the dipyridamole and avoid consuming coffee, tea, chocolate, or cola during the 24 hours that precede the test.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the theophylline
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Interrupt a treatment with theophylline at least 5 days before myocardial perfusion imaging with the dipyridamole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the disopyramide by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly adjustment of the dosage of the disopyramide during the administration of these medications together and 1 to 2 weeks after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide due to decrease of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the disopyramide

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide: severe hypoglycemia, lengthening of the QT interval, and serious ventricular arrhythmias, especially of the torsade de pointes type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical, biological and EKG monitoring,

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the disulfiram and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of cocaine due to decrease of its metabolism by the disulfirame, with increased risk of the onset of torsades de pointes
Disorders of behavior and of coordination
Risk of episodes of acute psychosis or confused state, reversible upon stopping the administration of the two substances together
Large and rapid increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of toxicity (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these substances together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and monitoring of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin during the treatment with the disulfiram and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3gr per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 gr per day):
Acute renal insufficiency in dehydrated patients due to decrease of the glomerular filtration as a result of a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Furthermore, reduction of the anti-hypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the start of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Acute renal insufficiency with the patient at risk (older patient and/or dehydrated one) due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilator prostaglandins due to the NSAIs). Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the start of treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In case of dehydration caused by the diuretics, increased risk of acute functional renal insufficiency, in particular when large doses of the contrast media are used.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Rehydrate before administration of the iodinated product

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the nephrotoxic and ototoxic risks of the aminoglycoside (functional renal insufficiency linked to the dehydration caused by the diuretic)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The two medications may be taken together when there is monitoring of the state of hydration, of the renal and cochleovestibulary functions, and possibly, of the plasma concentrations of the aminoglycoside

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plas ma concentrations of lithium with signs of overdose of lithium as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
Lactic acidosis due to the metformin, set into action by a possible functional renal insufficiency, linked to the loop diuretics
Risk of addition of the ototoxic and/or nephrotoxic effects

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)
OTHER POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Contraindication unless there is hypokalemia.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)
ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperkalemia (possibly lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the effects of the hyperkalemia inducing substances)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --if administering these medications together is justified, strict testing of the kalemia and of the renal function.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The rational choice of these two medications, useful for some patients, does not exclude the onset of hypokalemia or, in particular with patients having renal insufficiency and diabetes, of hyperkalemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the kalemia, possibly EKG and, if there is reason to, reconsider the treatment.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -if the administration of the two medications together is justified, strict testing of the kalemia and of the renal function.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of lithium with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially with renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -aside from hypokalemia or in case of parenteral use of the potassium salts

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of abrupt arterial hypotension and/or acute renal insufficiency at the beginning of or at an increase in the dosage of a treatment with an angiotensin II antagonist where there is pre-existing fluid depletion.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With arterial hypertension, where there has been pre-existing diuretic treatment that has caused fluid depletion, it is necessary:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of symptomatic hyponatremia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring. If possible, use another class of diuretics.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the creatinemia without modification of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin, even in the absence of fluid depletion. Also risk of hyperuricemia and of complications such as gout

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The rational choice of these medications, useful for some patients, does not exclude the onset of hypokalemia or, in particular with patients having renal insufficiency and diabetes, of hyperkalemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the kalemia, possibly EKG and, if there is reason to, reconsider the treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of abrupt arterial hypotension and/or renal insufficiency at the start of or when there is an increase of the dosage of the treatment with the ACE inhibitor in cases of pre-existing fluid depletion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In arterial hypertension, when there is fluid depletion from previous treatment with a diuretic, it is necessary:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypercalcemia due to decrease of the urinary elimination of the calcium.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of lithium with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a reduced sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of the plasma concentrations of lithium and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the docetaxel due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the cytotoxic due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the undesirable dose-dependent effects of the docetaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the hydroquinidine and risk of overdose (decrease of the renal excretion of the hydroquinidine by alkalinizing of the urine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the blood concentrations of the hydroquinidine; if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the alkalinizing treatment and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quinidine and risk of overdose (decrease of the renal excretion of the quinidine by alkalinizing of the urine).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the blood concentrations of quinidine; if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the alkalinizing treatment and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dolutegravir due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in case of resistance to the class of integrase inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of metformin by the dolutegravir and of its undesirable effects of the lactic acidosis type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --With the patient having moderate renal insufficiency (stage 3a, clearance of the creatinin between 45 and 59 ml/min), clinical and biological monitoring, and possible adjustment of the dosage of metformin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of dolutegravir due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort.
Risk of problems with ventricular rhythm, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of domperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Reciprocal antagonism between the dopaminergic and the neuropleptic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an antiemetic that does not have extrapyramidal effects.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism between the dopaminergic and the tetrabenazine
Reciprocal antagonism of the dopamine agonist and the neuroleptics
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the doxorubicin due to increase of its plasma concentrations
Decrease of the plasma concentations of the doxycycline due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the doxycycline.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without significant modification of the active metabolite
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the dronedarone and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Doubling of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding

Depression of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia) and disorders of atrioventricular conduction. In addition, increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the metabolism of the digoxin. Clinical monitoring and EKG.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the doses of digoxin by half.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with the calcium channel blocker with minimum recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the docetaxel due to decrease of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin.
Large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to decrease of its metabolism
Large increase of the concentrations of drodedarone due to decrease of its metabolism
Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without significant modification of the active metabolite
Increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to inhibition of its metabolism by the grapefruit
Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the quinidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with the quinidine at the minimum recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without significant modification of the active metabolite.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin)

Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment by the calcium channel blocker with the lowest recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of more than double of the concentrations of drosperinone when taken with the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a contraceptive with another progestin, especially in cases of hyperkalemia

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the duloxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enoxacin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecainide with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the duloxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of metoprolol with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone with risk of overdose due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the duloxetine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)

VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of neuropsychological disorders
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dopaminergic with possible increase of its activity or appearance of signs of overdose.

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

Increase of immunosupression
Risk of possibly fatal generalized vaccine disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: as well as for the three months following the end of the treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Regardless of the route of administration of the econazole:
increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with econazole and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the atazanavir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the two substances together proves necessary, adjustment of the dosage of the atazanavir with regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of atovaquone by the enzymatic inducer
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye.)
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the amprenavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the indinavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Decrease by about half of the concentrations of rifabutin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the efavirenz
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjustment of the dosage of the rifabutin during the treatment with efavirenz.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the efavirenz due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the efavirenz
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole and of the efavirenz during the administration of the two together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the statins, due to inhibition of their hepatic recapture
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the statin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of ethinylestradiol, with risk of lower contraceptive effectiveness. Furthermore, increase of the concentrations of the progestin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an estroprogestin contraceptive with at leaset 30g of ethinylestradiol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase pf the plasma concentrations of elvitegravir by decrease of its metabolism by the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the elvitegravir co-administered with cobicistat, clinical monitoring. Limit the maximum dose of itraconazole to 200 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of elvitegravir by decrease of its metabolism by the ketoconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the elvitegravir co-administered with cobicistat, clinical monitoring. Limit the maximum dose of ketoconazole to 200 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the minimal concentrations of elvitegravir
Increase of the plasma concentrations of caffeine, which can lead to agitation and hallucinations, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the duloxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enoxacin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ropinirole with signs of overdose due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the ropinirole during the treatment with the enoxacin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Overdose of theophylline due to substantial decrease of its metabolism
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the entacapone and of the iron due to chelation of the latter by the entacapone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the entacapone (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the active fraction of the enzalutamide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose of enzalutamide by half when it is administered with the gemfibrozil

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of arterial hypertension, of constriction of coronary arteries
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 6 to 24 hours, depending on the triptan, between its dose and that of the ergot alkaloid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommendedthat the erythromycin be administered as far as possible from the afatinib, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the erythromycin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering medication. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with substantial increase of sedation
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with the erithromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self- monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these medications are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the medication tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the erythromycin administered by oral route: increase of the plasma concentration of the pravastatin by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring during the treatment with the antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent).
Overdose of theophylline due to decrease of its hepatic elimination, more particularly dangerous in children
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the erythromycin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of clinical hypothyroidism in cases of estrogen replacement therapy.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal treatment, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the oxcarbazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the estrogen-progestin or of the progestatif, with risk of lower contraceptive effectiveness.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the length of time that the two substances are administered together and for a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of its hepatic metabolism

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type, should be used during the time the substances are administered together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate decrease of the concentrations of ethinylestradiol

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the telaprevir

Increase of the hepatotoxicity
Increase of the concentrations of ethinylestradiol by the etoricoxib
Increase of the hepatotoxicity.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ethosuximide

In the treatment of infections with Mycobacterium avium complex, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the clarithromycin due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the etravirine

Increase of the risk of reaction to the contrast media in cases of previous treatment with interleukin2:
skin rash or more rarely low blood pressure, oliguria, or even renal failure
Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus by the ciclosporin. The nephrotoxicity of the ciclosprorin is also increased when the two medications are administered together

Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil

For one thing, increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to increase of the concentrations of ezetimibe; for another thing, possible increase of the concentrations of ciclosporin
Risk of gallstones due to increase of the biliary excretion of cholesterol

Increase of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the carbamazepine. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of felbamate due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosages of the two anticonvulsants.
