INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin, and if needed, adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the felbamate.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the valproic acid, with risk of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the valproate or of the valpromide during the treatment with the felbamate and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity of the ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring of the renal function, during and after the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of gallstones due to increase of the biliary excretion of cholesterol
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another opioid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to slight decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another opioid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Lypothymia, even loss of consciousness attributed to the rapid release of the iron in its complex form and to the saturation of the transferrin
Decrease of the digestive absorption of these two medications due to chelation of the iron
For the iron salts administered via oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the bisphosphonates
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the bisphosphonates (from 30 minutes minimum to more than 2 hours apart, if possible, depending on the bisphosphonate).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the iron salts by oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the iron salts
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from meals and in the absence of calcium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the tetracycline antibiotics administered by oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics (formation of complexes)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the entacapone and of the iron due to chelation of the latter by the entacapone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the entacapone (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more that 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the iron (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the levodopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the levodopa (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the methyldopa (formation of complexes)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the methyldopa (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the penicillamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the penicillamine (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the strontium.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the strontium at a different time from the iron salts (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the zinc by the iron
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the zinc (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolosis type and of pharmacodynamic antagonism between the two molecules
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fibrate and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable muscular effects of these substances, and especially of rhabdomyolosis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, particularly at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of undesirable effects (dose-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type. Furthermore, with the gemfibrozil, decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin and of the rosuvastatin, which increases the muscular risk, as well as the nephrotoxicity of the rosuvastatin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the gemfibrozil and the simvastatin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the bradycardia inducing effects which can have fatal consequences. The beta-blocking agents are even more at risk since they inhibit the adrenergic compensation mechanisms
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and continuous EKG during the 24 hours following the first dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800mg/day: increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the cimetidine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the diltiazem.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the erythromycin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the fluconazole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when administered with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecanaide with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecainide, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecainide with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the flecainide by decrease of its metabolism by the mirabegron
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the administration of it and the mirabegron together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when there is treatment with the fluconazole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of lengthening of the QT interval
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, especially with strong doses of fluconazole (800 mg/day)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fluconazole and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the apixaban by the flucoonazole, with increase of the risk of bleeding
For doses of fluconazole >=200 mg per day: possible increase of the undesirable effects of the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of carbamazepine, during and after the end of the antifungal treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the fluconazole. If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, testing beforhand of the QT and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its metabolism and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the immunosuppressant's dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by half, that is 150 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the losartan, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluconazole
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with midazolam by mouth

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Doubling of the concentrations of nevirapine with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the nevirapine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of olaparib by the fluconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 200mg twice a day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects, especially respiratory ones, of the oxycodone due to decrease of its metabolism by the fluconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the oxycodone during the treatment with the fluconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma oncentrations of phenytoin that can reach toxic values. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical and biological monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the treatment with the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the fluconazole by increase of its metabolism by the rifampacin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the rivaroxaban by the fluconazole, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the half life of the sulfonamide with possible onset of hypoglycemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide during the treatment with the fluconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the clearance of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the fluconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent CBC

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of pulmonary toxicity that could be fatal.
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fluoroquinolone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more that 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Possible increase of the risk of tendinitis, even of rupture of the tendon (exceptional), particularly in patients receiving prolonged corticotherapy
Decrease of the concentrations of the mycophenolic acid by about a third, with potential risk of reduction of effectiveness.
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the strontium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the strontium at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the fluoroquinolone (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the fluoroquinlones (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Strengthening of the effects, both cytostatic and undesirable, of the fluorouracil.
Large increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If taking these medications together cannot be avoided, more frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cytotoxic and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the gastrointestinal toxicity of the fluorouracil
Increase of the toxicity of the fluourouracil due to decrease of its clearance
Increase of the toxicity of the fluorouracil due to decrease of its clearance
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine, and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzymatic inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, especially with excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluoxetine.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the length of the treatment with the fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the nebivolol, especially with excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the antidepressant
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the nebivolol during the length of the treatment with the antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the active fraction of the risperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluoxetine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the risperidone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluoxetine.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of clozapine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the duloxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine with possibilities of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine during and after the administration of the two substances together. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methodone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical monitoring and EKG; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mexiletine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluvoxamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. Adjustment of the dosage of the mexiletine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of the olanzapine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the olanzapine during the treatment with fluvoxamine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of pirfenidone with signs of overdose
Increase of the plasma concentrations of propranolol due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of the activity and of the undesirable effects, for example: significant bradycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propranolol during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ropinirole, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the ropinirole during the treatment with fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with signs of overdose (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations, and adjustment, if there is reason for it, of the dosage of the phenobarbital during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase or of decrease of the effects of the A to take into account buprenorphine [sic], simultaneously by inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Risk of lower effectiveness of the amprenavir.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Significant decrease of the concentrations of amprenavir that can lead to a loss of viralogical response
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ampernavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of lower effectiveness of the amprenavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the alfuzosin and of its undesirable effects.
.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the alfuzosin by decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the therapy with the two medications.
Risk of severe hypocalcemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the calcemia and supplementation if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dacarbazine in large doses: risk of pulmonary toxicity (adult acute respiratory distress syndrome ).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not use these medications simultaneously, but wait a week between the last administration of fotemustine and the first day of the treatment with dacarbazine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the diuretic effect which can reach 50%
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Possibly use higher doses of furosemide.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the didanosine, and especially the mitochondrial toxicity, due to substantial increase of its concentrations. In addition, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ganciclovir due to decrease of its concentrations, if the two medications are ingested in an interval of less than 2 hours
Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Stop the zidovudine temporarily; CBC, and, reintroduce, if possible, the zidovudine in small doses.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the dasabuvir by the gemfibrozil
Increase of the active fraction of the enzalutamide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose of enzalutamide by half when administered with the gemfibrozil.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the glitazone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the gemfibrozil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of severe hypoglycemia, even coma, due to substantial increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide by the gemfiborzil

Risk of reduced effectiveness of the glibenclamide due to decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of the inducer effect of the bosentan. Furthermore, cases of hepatoxicity have been reported with these substances administered together.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the glycemia, adjustment of the treatment if needed, and monitoring of the hepatic biological constants

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of the onset of angioedema, due to the reduction of the activity of the enzyme dipetidyl peptidase-4 (DDP-4) by the gliptin, in patients treated with the angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of cardiovascular mortality
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of cardiovascular mortality
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The plasma concentrations of aliskiren increase by nearly 6 times and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the aliskiren when grapefruit is consumed
Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
With diabetic patients or those with renal insufficiency, increase of the undesirable effects such as hypotension, hyperkaliemia
Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Excessive immunodepression with risk of lymphoproliferative disorders (LPDs)
Risk of possibly fatal general illness. This risk is increased in older patients already immunodepressed by the underlying disease.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In particular, use an inactivated vaccine when one exists (poliomyelitis)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3 gr per day)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Glucocorticoids (general and rectal routes): possible impact of the corticotherapy on the metabolism of the Vitamin K antagonist and on that of the factors of coagulation. Risk of hemorrhage specific to the corticotherapy (digestive mucosa, vascular fragility) in large doses or in treatment prolonged beyond 10 days.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: When administering substances from these groups together is justified, strengthen monitoring: if the situation requires, with the vitamin K antagonists, biological testing on the 8th day, then every two weeks after that during the corticotherapy and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the inducer: the consequences are particularly great with patients who have Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of organ transplants
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of ulceration and of gastrointestinal hemorrhage
With the glucocorticoids by IV route: risk of severe myopathy, reversible after a possibly long period (several months).
Possible increase of the risk of tendinitis, even of rupture of the tendon (exceptional), particularly in patients receiving corticotherapy for a prolonged period

Described for prednisolone.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the isoniazid. Mechanism proposed: increase of the hepatic metabolism of the isoniazid and decrease of that of the glucocorticoides
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin; the consequences are particularly great in patients with Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of transplants
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the exception of inhaled and local routes, and for doses greater than 10mg/day of prednisone-equivalent (or > 2mg/kg/day for a child or > 20mg/day for a child weighing more than 10 kg) during more than two weeks and for the "bolus" of corticoids: risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: And during the 3 months following the end of the therapy with the corticoid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K Antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of lithium with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the griseofulvin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with griseofulvin and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type, should be used during the time the two substances are administered together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the length of time these substances are administered together and a cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the guanethidine used by IV route: risk of unforeseeable vascular reactions, especially hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Interrupt the treatment with the MAOI two weeks before the treatment with guanethidine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the fluconazole. If the administration of these substances together cannot be avoided, testing beforehand of the QT and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arryhthmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the inhibitor. If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, testing beforehand of the QT and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the macrolide. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT interval before the beginning of the treatment and EKG monitoring

CLASS.name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the progestogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of rilpivirine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of ineffectiveness of the treatment by the antidepressant
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of simeprevir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of sofosbuvir due to decrease of its intestinal absorption by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --wth the rifampicin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its absorption by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administration of these together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring during the administration and 1 to 2 weeks after the inducer is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the vermurafenib, with lower effectiveness
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the vortioxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the administration with the inducer and 1 to 2 weeks after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the pharmacological effects, and especially increase in blood pressure and contraction of the blood vessels, by the catecholamines due to the combined inhibition of their metabolism
Risk of orthostatic hypotension, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the doxazosin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of orthostatic hypotension, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the doxazosine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of significant hypotension (synergic effect) capable of aggravating the state of myocardial ischemia and provoking an acute cardiac accident
Increase (very large for the avanafil and the vardenafil) of the plasma concentrations of the type 5 phosphodiesterase inhibitor, with risk of hypotension (severe with the vardenafil)
INTERACTION.SEVERITY: To know the risks and the levels of constraint for each Type 5 phosphodiesterase inhibitor with the strong inhibitors of CYP3A4, consult the AMM ["Authorisation de la mise au march", a French document for all medications authorized to be marketed in France with information about them] specific for each one of them.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large drop in blood pressure (synergic effect)
Possibly serious medullary insufficiency
With large doses of the inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of theophylline due to inhibition of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the theohyllinemia up to two to three weeks after the beginning of the treatment with the inhibitor; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3gr per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 gr per day):
Acute renal insufficiency in dehydrated patients due to decreased glomerular filtration following a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of mortality from cardiovascular disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In situations where the administration of these medications together is possible, increased risk of degradation of renal function, even acute renal insufficiency, and increase of the hyperkalemia as well as hypotension and fainting or loss of consciousness.

Acute renal insufficiency with patients at risk (older patients, dehydrated ones, those taking diuretics, those having altered renal function) due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilating prostaglandins due to the NSAIs). These effects are generally reversible. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment and regularly during the administration of these substances together.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --if the administration of these medications together is justified, strict testing of the kalemia and of the renal function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of abrupt arterial hypotension and/or acute renal insufficiency at the start of or when there is an increase of the dosage of the treatment with the ACE inhibitor in cases of pre-existing fluid depletion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In arterial hypertension, when there is fluid depletion from a previous treatment with a diuretic, it is necessary:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hyperkalemia, especially with older patients.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict testing of the kalemia and of renal function during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioneurotic edema type (angioedema)
Increase of the risk of angioedema
Increase of the risk of the onset of angioedema, due to reduction of the activity of the enzyme dipetidyl peptidase-4 (DDP-4) by the gliptin, in patients treated with the ACE inhibitor

The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in a diabetic treated with insulin. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for insulin).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of lithium which can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the use of an ACE inhibitor is indispensable, strict monitoring of the plasma concentrations of lithium and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the gold salts administered by IV route: risk of nitritoid reaction when the ACE inhibitor is introduced (nausea, vomiting, vasomotor effects of the flushing type, hypotension, possibly a drop in blood pressure)
Hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Unless there is hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioedema type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --in case of preceding angioedema with ACE inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of angiodema

With the spironolactone at dosages from 12.5 to 50 mg per day, and with low doses of ACE inhibitors
In the treatment of class III or IV heart failure (NYHA) with an ejection fraction <35% and previous treatment with an ACE inhibitor + a loop diuretic: risk of hyperkalemia, potentially lethal, in case of failure to follow the prescribed doses for this combination of medications.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Verify the absence of pre-existing hyperkalemia and renal insufficiency. Strict biological monitoring of the kalemia and of the creatinemia (1 time per week during the first month, then one time per month thereafter).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in diabetic patients treated with glucose lowering sulfonamides. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for the glucose lowering sulfonamides)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Stop the treatment with the HMG Co-A reductase inhibitor before starting a treatment with fusidic acid or use another antibiotic

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable muscular effects of these substances, and especially of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these medications together cannot be avoided, reinforce biological monitoring (dosage of the CPK more than once a week) and strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the statins, due to inhibition of their hepatic recapture
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the statin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of undesirable effects (dose-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type. Furthermore, with the gemfibrozil, decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin and of the rosuvastatin, which increases the muscular risk, as well as the nephrotoxicity of the rosuvastatin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the gemfibrosil and the simvastatin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the statin and of its undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolosis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the rosuvastatin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of the onset of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce clinical and biological monitoring, especially during the first weeks of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that that the protease inhibitor be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the ritonavir, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Variation of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, most often by decreasing it
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the length of the treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use weaker doses of atorvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease, possibly very large, of the plasma concentrations of the atovaquone due to increase of its metabolism

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency
Decrease of the concentrations of the boceprevir and of the lopinavir (or darunavir or fosamprenavir), with risk of therapeutic failure
Risk of increase or decrease of the effects of the buprenorphine, due to both inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of the clarithromycin and of its active metabolite due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of treatment with these medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyyproterone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --in its use as a hormonal contraceptive: use instead another method ofcontraception in particular a barrier type, during the administration of these substances together and a cycle following

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia, more marked for intravenous route, due to increase of the absorption of the digoxin or decrease of its renal clearance.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with possible adjustment of the dosage of digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the ritonavir
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive, because of the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the length of the treatment with these medications together and a cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the thyroid hormones.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these substances are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosages of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentration of the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor or of the CYP3A4 inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: To know the risks and levels of severity of each ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor taken with the strong inhibitors of CYP3A4, consult the specificauthorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together. Administering large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day) is not recommended.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -Avoid beginning the treatment with ritonavir during the period of adjustment of the dosage of lamotrigine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to the enzymatic inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (reduction of the antiretroviral effectiveness)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of the substances being taken together by accident, do not stop the St Johns wort abruptly, but test the plasma concentrations (or the effectiveness) of the protease inhibitor before and then after the St Johns wort is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness because of decrease of the concentrations of hormonal contraceptive, due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the time the substances are administered together and one cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor (even more so when the dosage of the rifabutin is large) for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin, for another thing.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
For the combination (saquinavir + ritonavir):
risk of severe hepatocellular toxicity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Until additional information about the ritonavir "boosted" protease inhibitors is available.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the rosuvastatin due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolisis type (decrease of the hepatic metoblism of the simvastatin).
Decrease of the concentrations of the telaprevir and of the darunavir or of the fosamprenavir, with risk of therapeutic failure.
With the atazanavir, the darunavir or the lopinavir, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of administration of these together, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day. The administration with the other protease inhibitors of HIV has not been studied.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the theophylline, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the protease inhibitor and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large reduction of the concentrations of the antifungal due to increase of its metabolism by the ritonavir, with risk of failure of the treatment
Possible increase of the sedative effect of the alprazolam
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the enzymatic inducer
Risk of decrease of the bioavailability of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, by reason of its pH dependent absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -except with the vandetanib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the bioavailability of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, by reason of its pH dependent absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -except with the imatinib and the vandetanib

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the axitinib, the bosutinib, the ceritinib, the cobimetinib, the dabrafenib, the dasatinib, the nilotinib, the sunitinib

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of the coronary arteries or of those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure.

Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the alfuzosin and of its undesirable effects
Possible increase of the sedative effect of the alprazolam
Increase of the undesirable effects of the calcium channel blockers, most often of the hypotension type, especially in older patients.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and dosage adjustment during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with darifenacine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the apixaban by the inhibitor, with increased risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of bedaquiline due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If taking these medications together is necessary, more frequent EKG and monitoring of the transaminases are recommended.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially neurological, of the bortezomib due to decrease of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the bortezomib during the length of the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of the undesirable effects of the bosentan, especially of hepatic attacks, due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring during the administration of these together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of the active metabolite of the brentuximab, with risk of neutropenia
Risk of increase of the undesirable dose dependent effects of the cabazitaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the cabazitaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the cobicistat or of the inhibitor of CYP3A4
INTERACTION.COMMENT: To know the risks and levels of severity of each interaction,consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the macrolides

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of daclatasvir by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of daclatasvir should be decreased to 30mg once a day when it is administered with the inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo or fainting type.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the disopyramide.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable dose-dependent effects of the docetaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of domperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Large increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the eplerenone by the inhibitor and of its undesirable effects, especially hyperkalemia
Risk of increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to slight decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the inhibitor. If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, testing beforehand of the QT and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increaese of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase (very large for avanafil and vardenafil) of the plasma concentrations of the type 5 phospodiesterase inhibitor, with risk of hypotension (severe with vardenafil)
INTERACTION.SEVERITY: Contraindication - Not recommended - Precaution for use
INTERACTION.COMMENT: To know the risks and levels of severity for each type 5 phospodiesterase inhibitor, consult the specific authorization for sale to the public ("Authorisation de la Mise sur le Marche" a French document) for each one of them.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitor or of the inhibitor of CYP3A4
INTERACTION.COMMENT: To know the risks and levels of severity for each protease inhibitor boosted by ritonavir with the strong inhibitors of CYP3A4, consult the specific authorization for sale to the public (Authorisation de la Mise sur le March a French document) for each one of them.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with axitinib, bosutinib, ceritinib, cobimetinib, dabrafenib, dasatinib, nilotinib, sunitinib

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the irinotecan due to increase of the plasma concentrations of its active metabolite
Increase of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the ketoconazole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor).
Large increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by a fourth, that is 150 mg every other day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lomitapide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of maraviroc must be decreased to 150 mg twice a day when administered with this inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In case of prolonged use, increase of the plasma concentration of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the in inhibitor, with risk of appearance of a cushings syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the midazolam by mouth

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the olaparib by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 150 mg twice a day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ombitsavir + paritaprevir combination due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --except with ritonavir

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects, especially respiratory ones, of the oxycodone due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of oxycodone during the treatment with the inhibitor and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones, of the panobinostat due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the panobinostat

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk increase of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Large increase of the concentrations of quetiapine, with risk of overdose
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinine, especially ventricular arrhythmias and neurosensory disorders (cinchonism).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the protease inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ranolazine due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of riociquat due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of rivaroxaban, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of simeprevir due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the undesirable effects specific to each substrate, with frequently severe consequences
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the cardiac arrhythmia type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: with the patient who has severe renal or hepatic insufficiency

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the DM1, a componant element of the trastuzumab emtansine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the inhibitor, and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Slight increase of the sedative effect of the zolpidem
Slight increase of the sedative effect of the zopiclone
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, more frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the oral anticoagulant during the administration with the SSRI and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tricyclic antidepressant with risk of convulsions and increase of the undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring and, if necessary, adjustment of the dosage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the antidepressant
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait at least two weeks between the discontinuation of the irreversible MAOI and the start of treatment with the SSRI, and at least a week between the end of treatment with the SSRI (except fluoxetine: five weeks) and the beginning.

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, very strict clinical monitoring. Begin the administration with minimum recommended dosages.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of appearance of convulsions and/or a serotonin syndrome
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Increase of the hypoglycemic reaction (inhibition of the compensation reactions which can facilitate the onset of hypoglycemic coma)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia: decrease or increase of the needs for insulin, due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient of the risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of the insulin if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

CLASS.name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Elevation of the glycemia by the beta-2 mimetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen blood and urine monitoring

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the start of treatment, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the start of treatment, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With large dosages (100 mg per day of chlorpromazine): elevation of the glycemia (decrease of the freeing of the insulin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the neuroleptic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in a diabetic treated with insulin. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for insulin).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the gastrointestinal toxicity of the fluorouracil
Increase of the risk of digestive system hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Probable decrease of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the irinotecan, with risk of failure of the cytotoxic treatment
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the irinotecan due to increase of the plasma concentrations of its active metabolite
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the irinotecan, with risk of failure of the cytotoxic treatment
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the ketoconazole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of isavuconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort

Increase of the hepatotoxic effect of the isoniazid, with increased formation of its toxic metabolites.
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of a scheduled intervention, it is prudent to stop the treatment with the isoniazid a week before the surgery and only restart it two weeks after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Disorders of behavior and of coordination

Described for the prednisolone.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the isoniazide. Mechanism proposed: increase of the hepatic metabolism of the isoniazide and decrease of that of the glucocorticoides
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ketoconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Space the doses of the two anti-infectives at lease 12 hours apart. Monitor the plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole and possibly adjust its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Overdose of phenytoin (decrease of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring, plasma concentration dosage of phenytoin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the isoniazid and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Addition of the hepatotoxic effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hepatoxicity of the isoniazid (increase of the formation of toxic metabolites of the isoniazid)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring of this classic combination. In case of hepatitis, stop the isoniazid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of facilitating systemic uptake of the aluminum salts especially when there is altered renal function
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take aluminum based gastrointestinal medications at a different time (more than 2 hours apart if possible) from the citrates, including the natural ones such as citrus fruits and juices.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Notable decrease of the plasma concentrations of the abiraterone, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the patient having heart failure, risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metopolol during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Substantial decrease of the plasma concentrations of the abiraterone, with risk of lower effectiveness
Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the itraconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the itraconazole be administered as far distant from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours away from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase by nearly six times of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the antisecretory
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the proton pump inhibitor
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the itraconazole and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of aprepitant due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the intraconazole.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buprenorphine during the treatment with the inhibitor and, if the situation requires, after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with substantial increase of sedation
With the busulfan in large doses: doubling of the concentrations of busulfan by the itraconazole
Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the cobicistat
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these together. The administration of large doses of itraconazole (>200mg per day) is not recommended

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of more than double the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia with adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the itraconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of elvitegravir due to decrease of its metabolism by the itraconazole
