INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the elvitegravir in combination with cobicistat, clinical monitoring. Limit the maximum dose of itraconazole to 200 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of tinnitis and/or loss of hearing acuity: cinchonism linked to a decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the antiarrhythmic by the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the antiarrhythmic and possible decrease of its dosage if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immusuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these substances are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Risk of increase of the concentrations of itraconazole by the protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together. Administering large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day) is not recommended.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially of edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydorpyridine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the torsadegenic medication. If administering these two together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, as well as tinnitis and/or decrease of auditory acuity (cinchonism), due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the quinidine
Large increase of the concentrations of salmeterol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin)
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of telaprevir and of the itraconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. Avoid large doses of itraconazole (>200 mg per day).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration with the itraconazole, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide should be limited to 10 mg per day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the trabectedin by the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together is necessary, clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the trabectedin during the length of the treatment with the itraconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole

Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of these substances together and after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes. In addition, increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine due to decrease of its metabolism by the azithromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor).
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the josamycin).
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its intestinal metabolism by the grapefruit).
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of the two substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules
Increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by half, that is 150 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of the ivacaftor, with risk of loss of effectiveness
Large increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by a fourth, that is 150 mg every other day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and. if needed, plasma dosage and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration with the macrolide and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide: severe hypoglyclemia, lengthening of the QT interval, and serious ventricular arrhythmias, especially of the torsades de pointes type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical, biological and electrocardiographic monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the macrolide. If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, testing before hand of the QT and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the josamycin).
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of sildenafil, with risk of hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with sildenafil at the minimun dose when it is administered with josamycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus and of the creatinemia, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the tacrolimus by the josamycin
Risk of increase of the theophyllinemia, particularly with children
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the ketoconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the ketoconazole be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or 12 hours away from doses of the afatinib

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the antisecretory
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the anitsecretory
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buprenorphine during the treatment with the inhibitor and, if the situation requires, after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of more than double of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias with predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of elvitegravir due to decrease of its metabolism by the ketoconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the elvitegravir combined with cobicistat, clinical monitoring. Limit the maximum dose of ketoconazole to 200 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicine
Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these substances are administered together, strict monitoring of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ketoconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Space the doses of the two anti-infectives at lease 12 hours apart. Monitor plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole and possibly adjust its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydropyridine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the medication tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand, and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Increase of the plasma concentrations of nevirapine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole for one thing, and decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine, for another thing
Increase of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the ketoconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Large increase of the concentrations of salmeterol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolisis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering substance)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration with the ketoconazole, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of vanlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cladribine by the lamivudine
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Risk of increase of the neurological effects (vertigo, ataxia, diplopia) of the carbamazepine when the lamotrigine is introduced
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -avoid starting an oral contraceptive during the period of adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -Avoid beginning the treatment with ritonavir during the period of adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the lamotrigine with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the oxcarbazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations, with adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine if needed.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of serious cutaneous reactions (Lyell's syndrome). In addition, increase of the plasma concentrations of lamotrigine (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the sodium valproate)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this combination of medications is judged necessary, strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of these medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Only with the bitherapy ledipasvir/sofosbuvir, onset of bradycardia, possibly abruptly, which can have fatal consequences.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of patients is recommended, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the bitherapy (clinical monitoring and EKG).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzymatic inducer.
Decrease of the concentrations of the ledipasvir when the proton pump inhibitor is administered before the ledipasvir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the proton pump inhibitor and the ledipasvir be administered simultaneously

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the statin and of its undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolysis type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the rosuvastatin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ripampicin
When co-administered with a protease inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir by the ledipasvir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, especially of the renal function

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Doubling of the concentrations of ambrisentan, with increase of the vasodilator effect (severe headaches )
Increased risk of onset of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical and biological monitoring, especially during the first weeks of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant and more notable increase of the concentrations of the lercanidipine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Separate the time when the two medications are taken. Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment if necessary of its dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydorpyridine
Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydropyridine
Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially of edema, due to decrease of the intestinal metabolism of the dihydropyridine
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the levocarnitine and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of aggravation of the Parkinsonian syndrome or of undesirable central effects (visual hallucinations, confusion, headaches)
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the levodopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the levodopa (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of orthostatic hypotension
Increase of the effects of the levodopa but equally of its undesirable effects. Increase of the antihypertensive effect of the methyldopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly decrease of the doses of levodopa.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the neuroleptic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an antiemitic without extrapyramidal effects.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the neuroleptics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With a parkinsons patient, use the minimum effective doses of each of the two medications.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Inhibition of the effects of the levodopa
When administered with the carbidopa: inhibition of the absorption of the carbidopa with decrease of the plasma concentrations of the levodopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the levodopa.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the tetrabenazine

CLASS.name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administrations of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine, with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with amiodarone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the lidocaine administered by IV route: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine during the administration of the substances together and after the beta-blocking agent is stopped. Adjustment if needed of the dosage of the lidocaine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure

With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with risk of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine with possibilities of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine during and after the administration of the two substances together. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarisation at the end of anesthesia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the linezolide by the clarithromycin, due to increase of its absorption
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the linezolide due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the linezolide during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of lithium with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium that can attain toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the use of the angiotensin II antagonist is indispensable, strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and adjustment of the dosage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium that can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, monitor the the plasma concentrations of lithium closely and adjust the dosage of the lithium during the administration of the substances together and after the NSAI is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In case of sudden discontinuation of consumption of coffee or of medications containing caffeine, risk of increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the calcitonin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of neurotoxicity manifesting as disorders of the cerebellum, confusion, drowsiness, ataxia. These disorders are reversible when the treatment with lithium is stopped
Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium with signs of overdose of lithium as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the the plasma concentrations of lithium with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium which can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the use of an ACE inhibitor is indispensable, strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the the plasma concentrations of lithium with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium which can attain toxic values, with signs of overdose of lithium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium which can attain toxic values with signs of overdose of lithium.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of neuropsychic signs evocative of a neuroleptic malignant syndrome or of lithium poisoning
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical amd biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the sodium salts
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid excessive sodium and take account of the presence of sodium in certain medications such as antacids.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the sodium salts.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid excessive sodium and take account of the presence of sodium in certain medications such as antacids.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the the plasma concentrations of lithium with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the the plasma concentrations of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of topiramate >= 200 mg/day: increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium that can reach toxic values, with signs of overdose of lithium.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring. Adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lomitapide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the lomitapide

Described for warfarin and acenocoumarol.
Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the aminoglutethimide
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with aminoglutethimide and two weeks after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the dexamethasone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjustment of the dosage of the dexamethasone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increased bone marrow toxicity (inhibition of the metabolism of the lomustine)
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the losartan, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluconazole
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the two together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT before hand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the substance tending to cause torsades de pointes. If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lurasidone due to decrease of its metabolism by the grapefruit
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of macitentan due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of macitentan due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dopaminergic with possible increase of its activity or appearance of signs of overdose.
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the macrolide and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic elimination of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremeties (decrease of the hepatic elimination of the ergotamine).
Decrease of the the plasma concentrations of lithium with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Significant decrease of the concentrations of amprenavir that could lead to a loss of the virological response
In the absence of the administration at the same time with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4, decrease of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of maraviroc must be increased to 600 mg twice a day in this situation.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of maraviroc must be reduced to 150 mg twice a day if it is taken with this inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of maraviroc that could lead to a loss of the virological response

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF A SEROTONIN SYNDROME
OTHER MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF A SEROTONIN SYNDROME

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance or of increased severity of a serotonin syndrome in case of administering any of these medications with any of the others.

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo and fainting type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the type 5 phospohdisterase inhibitors

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT HE ORIGIN OF ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of hypotension, especially orthostatic
Increased risk of nephrotoxicity and ototoxicity (the ototoxicity is cumulative in cases of successive administrations of the aminoglycosides)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in case of simultaneous administration

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the amphotericin B administered intravenously:
increased risk of nephrotoxicity
Risk of increase of the renal toxicity of the aminoglycoside.
Risk of increase of the effects of the botulinum toxin with the aminoglycosides (due to extrapolation from the effects observed during the course of the botulism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another antibiotic

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the nephrotoxicity of the aminoglycosides by the cefalotin is under discussion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of renal function

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Larger increase of the creatinemia than with ciclosporin alone, with increase of the nephrotoxic risk
Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarization at the end of anesthesia

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the nephrotoxic and ototoxic risks of the aminoglycoside (functional renal insufficiency linked to the dehydration caused by the diuretic)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The two medications may be taken together when there is monitoring of the state of hydration, of the renal and cochleovestibulary functions, and, possibly, of the plasma concentrations of the aminoglycoside.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Addition of the nephrotoxic and/or ototoxic effects, especially in the case of pre-existing renal insufficiency
Addition of the nephrotoxic effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring with an indisputable bacteriological justification

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Greater increase of the creatinemia than with tacrolimus alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances)

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT RISK WHEN WITHDRAWING FROM TOBACCO

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of overdose when replacing tobacco by the replacement therapy
Increase of the risk of hypotension, especially orthostatic

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT THE ORIGIN OF ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of hypotension, especially orthostatic

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS THAT LOWER THE EPILEPTIC THRESHOLD
OTHER MEDICATIONS THAT LOWER THE EPILEPTIC THRESHOLD

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Accrued risk of convulsions
Addition of the undesirable atropinic effects such as urinary retention, constipation, dry mouth
Risk of addition of the effects of the methomoglobinizing agents.
Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less than 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg in an hour for an adult.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, more frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the oral anticoagulant during the administration of these medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait two weeks between stopping the MAOI and the start of the other treatment, and at least a week between the end of that treatment and the start of the MAOI.

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, confusion, even coma
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, very strict clinical monitoring. Begin the administration of the substances together with minimum recommended dosages.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxysmal hypertension with possibility of ventricular arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)
Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity
Increase of the ototoxicity
Increase by the alcohol of the sedative effect of these substances. The alteration of alertness can make driving vehicles or using machines dangerous
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages or medications containing alcohol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of central nervous center depression. The alteration of alertness can make driving vehicles or using machines dangerous
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with sodium oxybate

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For the quinine administered by IV route: increased risk of onset of epileptic crises due to addition of the convulsion producing effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait at least 12 hours between the end of the administration via IV of the quinine and the beginning of the administration of the mefloquine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib by increase of its absorption by the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the amiodarone be administered as far as possible from the afatinib, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the amiodarone and a week after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of nephrotoxic effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosages of ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of the ciclosporin during the treatment with the amiodarone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the amiodarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with greater risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: For post surgical indications:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Only with the bitherapy daclatasvir/sofosbuvir:
Appearance of bradycardia, possibly abrupt, that can have fatal consequences.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these drugs together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and strict EKG, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the bitherapy

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Depression of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia) and difficulties with atrioventricular conduction. Furthermore, increase of the blood concentrations of digoxin due to decrease of the clearance of the digoxin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG and, if there is need for it, testing of the digoxinemia and adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For diltiazem by injection: risk of bradycardia and of atrioventricular block
For diltiazem by mouth: risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially in older persons.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with diltiazem administered by IV

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and electrical conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Risk of lengthening of the QT interval
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, particularly with large doses of fluconazole (800mg/d)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib by decease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg per day during the time these two medications are administered together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Only with the ledipasvir/sofosbuvir bitherapy, appearance of bradycardia, possibly abrupt, that can have fatal consequences
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the use of these medications together cannot be avoided, close monitoring of patients is recommended, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the bitherapy (clinical monitoring and EKG).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine, with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with amiodarone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of nintedanib due to increase of its absorption by the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of olaparib by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 200 mg twice a day with the amiodarone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the amiodarone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the therapy with ombitasvir+paritaprevir
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the amiodarone and of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin with signs of overdose, in particular neurological ones (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin and possible adjustment of its dosage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Only when administered with the combinations daclatasvir/sofosbuvir or ledispasvir/sofosbuvir:
Possibly abrupt appearance of bradycardia, which can have fatal consequences.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the combinations with sofosbuvir.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus due to inhibition of its metabolism by the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of tacrolimus during the administration of it and the amiodarone together and when the amiodarone is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia

For verapamil by injection:
-risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block.
For verapamil by mouth:
-risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -verapamil administered via IV

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, due to possible decrease of the metabolism of the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the amiodarone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
Increased risk of lactic acidosis when there is acute alcohol intoxication, particularly in cases of fasting or undernourishment, or in cases of liver failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Lactic acidosis due to the metformin, set into action by a possible functional renal insufficiency, linked to the loop diuretics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not use metformin when the creatinemia is greater than 15mg/l (135 mol/l) for men, and 12 mg/l (110mol/l) for women.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of metformin by the dolutegravir and of its undesirable effects of the lactic acidosis type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the patient having moderate renal insufficiency (stage 3a, clearance of the creatinine between 45 and 59 ml/min), clinical and biological monitoring , and possible adjustment of the dosage of metformin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Lactic acidosis linked to elevated concentrations of metformin in relation to the functional renal insufficiency induced by the radiological exam.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The treatment with metformin should be suspended at the time of the radiological exam and only started again 2 days later.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of respiratory depression, which can be fatal in case of overdose
Increased risk of respiratory depression which can be fatal in case of overdose
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone, with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methadone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical and electrocardiographic monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methadone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical and electrocardiographic monotoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the amprenavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase the frequency of the doses of methadone (2 to 3 times a day instead of once a day).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the methadone due to competitive blockage of the receptors.

CLASS.name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the citalopram, the domperidone, the escitalopram, the hydroxyzine and the piperaquine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Precipitation of crystals in the urinary tract (due to the acidification of the urine)
Increase of the toxicity, especially hematological, of the methotrezate (decrease of its renal clearance by the acetylsalicylic acid)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Contraindication with acetylsalicylic acid used in anatalgic, antipyretic, or anti-inflammatory doses

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the hepatoxicity of the methotrexate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together is judged necessary, strengthen liver function testing

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate (decrease of the renal clearance of the methotrexate by the NSAIs).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --for doses of methotrexate greater than 20mg per week

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate due to decrease of its elimination
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the methotrexate in doses > 20mg /week

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate and of the ciclosporin with increase of the creatinemia: reciprocal decrease of the clearances of the two medications
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosages of ciclosporin and of methotrexate. Adjustment of the dosage if necessary during the administration of the two together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate due to inhibition of its renal tubular secretion by the ciprofloxacin
Increase of the effects and of the hematological toxicity of the methothrexate: inhibition of the renal tubular secretion of the methotrexate by the penicillins
Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate: inhibition of the renal tubular secretion of the methotrexate by the probenecid
Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Concentration dosage of methotrexate. Adjustment of the dosage if necessary during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate (decrease of its renal excretion as well as inhibition of the dihydrofolate reductase)
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the methyldopa (formation of complexes)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the methyldopa (more than two hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the levodopa but equally of its undesirable effects. Increase of the antihypertensive effect of the methyldopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible decrease of the doses of levodopa.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of lithium which can attain toxic values, with signs of overdose of lithium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of 0.5g to 1 g of methylprednisolone administered in bolus: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of the INR 2 to 4 days after the bolus of mythylprednisolone or in the presence of signs of hemorrhage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the methylprednisolone administered by IV route: possible increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia Mecanism proposed: decrease of the hepatic elimination of the ciclosporin
In case of prolonged use, increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid, because of decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor, with risk of appearance of cushing syndrome
With the patient having heart failure, risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metropolol during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the metoprolol used for heart failure: risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the bupropion

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the metoprolol used for heart failure, and the cimetidine used at dosages greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the concentrations of the metoprolol, which can be dangerous in the case of treatment for heart failure, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetadine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with cimetidine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of metoprolol with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metopolol during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the metoprolol, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of metoprolol with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, with especially excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluoxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the length of the treatment with the fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the metoprolol used in heart failure: risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the hydroxychloroquine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the hydroxychloroquine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the metoprolol used in heart failure, increase of the plasma concentrations of the metoprolol due to decrease of its metabolism by the mirabegron
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the administration of it with the mirabegron

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, especially with excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the paroxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the paroxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metoprolol with reduction of its clinical effects (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta-blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
With the patient having heart failure, risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metronidazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of metronidazole during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the busulfan in large doses: doubling of the concentrations of busulfan by the metronidazole
Risk of episodes of acute psychosis or of confused state, reversible upon stopping the administration of the two substances together
Increase of the toxicity of the fluorouracil due to decrease of its clearance
Increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium which can attain toxic values with signs of overdose of lithium.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the the plasma concentrations of lithium and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metronidazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of metronidazole during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of false negative results of the test with metyrapone, due to a decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Double the dosage of the metyrapone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 40 mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of caffeine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the mexiletine
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mexiletine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluvoxamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. Adjustment of the dosage of the mexiletine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the antiarrhythmic activity, of the plasma concentrations, and of the half life of the mexiletine (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the mexiletine; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the mexiletine during the treatment with the phenytoin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the mexiletine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ineffectiveness of the mianserin
Unpredictable hemorrhages, possibly serious
Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin which can reach toxic values. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the miconazole by general route or oral gel: increase of the hypoglycemic effect with possible onset of hypoglycemic manifestations, even coma
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the midazolam by the anticonvulsant
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage during the treatment with the diltiazem

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to reduction of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the midazolam by mouth

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the midazolam by mouth

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of midazolam by the St Johns wort
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ombitasvir+ paritaprevir
Risk of absence of effect of the midazolam, with very large decrease of its plasma concentrations, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
Slight increase of sedation
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage during the treatment with the stiripentol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam (decrease of its hepatic metabolism with increase of sedation)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of midazolam during the treatment with the verapamil.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after the macrolide is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (increase of the bradycardia inducing effect of the midodrine) and disorders of atrioventricular conduction
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strengthen clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Hypertensive crises (inhibition of the metabolism of the pressor amines). Because of the length of action of the MAOI, this interaction is still possible two weeks after the MAOI is stopped.

Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the anticonvulsant
.
Risk of ineffectiveness of the treatment by the proton pump inhibitor due to decrease of its metabolism by the St Johns wort

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the vitamin K antagonist, by reason of its enzymatic inducer effect, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which could have possibly serious consequences (thrombolitic event)
