INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the antibiotic and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The use of another class of antibiotic is preferred; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the sulfonamide antibiotic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the antibiotic treatment and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Precipitation of crystals in the urinary tract (due to the acidification of the urine)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another class of antibiotic should be used; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the antibacterial sulfonamide and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, more frequent testing of the INR and adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with cotrimoxazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another class of antibiotic should be used; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the antibacterial sulfonamide and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Concentration dosage of methotrexate. Adjustment of the dosage if necessary during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The combination of two antiarrhythmic agents is very delicate. In the majority of cases, it is contraindicated or not recommended.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Not recommended

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Antabuse effect, especially for glibenclamide, glipizide, tolbutamide. Increase of the hypoglycemic reaction (inhibition of the compensation reactions) that can make possible the onset of hypoglycemic coma
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia: decrease or increase of the need for the blood glucose lowering sufonamide, due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

CLASS.name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA 2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Elevation of the glycemia by the beta-2 mimetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce blood and urine monitoring. Possibly change to insulin if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, especially at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, especially at the beginning of the treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With large doses (100mg per day of chlorpromazine): elevation of the glycemia (decrease of the release of the insulin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the neuroleptic during the treatment and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetique
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the antidiabetic during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the half life of the sulfonamide with possible onset of manifestations of hypoglymemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide during the treatment with the fluconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in diabetic patients treated with glucose lowering sulfonamides. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for the glucose lowering sulfonamides)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce self -monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the miconazole by general route or oral gel: increase of the hypoglycemic effect with possible onset of hypoglycemic manifestations, even coma
Decrease of the digoxinemia that can reach 50%
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the sulfasalazine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin due to increase of its metabolism by the sulfinpyrazone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with sulfinpyrazone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the sulpiride
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the sulpiride (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones
Risk of lengthening of the motor block, increased in the case of partial deficit of pseudo-cholinesterase

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or rapid elevation of blood pressure

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Hypertensive crises (inhibition of the metabolism of the pressor amines). Because of the length of action of the MAOI, this interaction is still possible two weeks after the MAOI is stopped
Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxysmal hypertension with the possibility of arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the pressor action of the sympathomimetic, most often moderate.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Only use under strict medical monitoring.

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: By extrapolation from the non selective MAOIs: risk of increase of the pressor action
INTERACTION.COMMENT: To be used only under strict medical monitoring.

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxysmal hypertension with possibility of arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)
Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of hypertensive crises.

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Perioperative hypertension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of scheduled surgery, it is preferable to stop the treatment several days before surgery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxystic hypertension, hyperthermia that can be fatal. Because of the length of action of the MAOI, this interaction is still possible two weeks after the MAOI has been stopped

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or rapid elevation of blood pressure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: with bupropion

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or rapid elevation of blood pressure
Greater increase of the creatinemia than with tacrolimus alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances)
Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus due to inhibition of its metabolism by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of tacrolimus during its administration with the amiodarone and when the amiodarone is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the amphotericin B administered by IV route: greater increase of the creatinemia than with tacrolimus alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances)
Risk of addition of the nephrotoxic effects, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment with the NSAI.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant, with risk of loss of immunosuppressive activity.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforced testing of the blood dosages of tacrolimus and possible increase of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran
Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus and adjustment of its dosage during the administration with the danazol and after it is stopped, with testing of the renal function.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus and of the creatinemia, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the tacrolimus by the josamycin
Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the two substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Essentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid administering these substances together unless there is preexisting hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and electrical conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure
Decrease of the digestive absorption of these two medications due to chelation of the iron
Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the terbinafine [sic]
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the duloxetine
Reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluoxetine
Reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the paroxetine
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the quinidine
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the terbinafine
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia
Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)
Increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the telaprevir and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the telaprevir and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the telaprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the administration of the substances together and two cycles after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the telaprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of its dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the telaprevir and of the darunavir or of the fosamprenavir, with risk of therapeutic failure
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of telaprevir and of the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. Avoid large doses of itraconaole (>200 mg per day).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin)
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its intracellular activity by the telaprevir
Increased risk of peripheral neuropathy
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the dogoxinemia during the treatment with the telithromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: When these are taken together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the cardiac arrhythmia type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: with the patient having severe renal or hepatic insufficiency

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the telithromycin by the St Johns wort
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmia, especially of torsades de pointes

Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the telithromycin by the rifampicin
Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering drug).
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the telithromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical and biological monitoring. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of lower effectiveness of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its intracellular activity by the boceprevir
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration with the ciclosporine, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the atazanavir, the darunavir or the lopinavir boosted with cobicistat, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day. The administration with the other protease inhibitors of HIV has not been studied.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its absorption by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these medications together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring during the administration and 1 to2 weeks after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the atazanavir, the darunavir or the lopinavir, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these are administered together, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day. Administration with the other protease inhibitors of HIV has not been studied.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration with the itraconazole, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration with the ketoconazole, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its absorption by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these medications together and 1 to 2 weeks after the rifampicin is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tenofovir alafenamide due to decrease of its intracellular activity by the telaprevir
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration with the verapamil, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10 mg per day

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity of the tenofovir, especially with large doses of the anti-inflammatory or in the presence of factors of risk of renal insufficiency.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: When these are administered together, monitor renal function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease by about a third of the exposure to the atazanavir in patients who are also taking tenofovir, compared to a healthy subject receiving the same substances together
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not administer the atazanavir with the tenofovir without ritonavir.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of failure of the antiretroviral treatment, even emergence of resistance. In addition, increase of the risk of the mitochondrial toxicity of the didanosine
When co-administered with a protease inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir by the ledipasvir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring, especially of the renal function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with terbinafine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecaidine during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
With the patient having heart failure, risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the terbinafine, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the terbinafine during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the terbinafine.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the vortioxetine due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the vortioxetine during the treatment with the terbinafine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of general vaccine disease, possibly fatal
Reciprocal antagonism between the dopaminergic and the tetrabenazine
Risk of hypertensive crises. Because of the duration of the action of the MAOI, this interaction is still theoretically possible two weeks after the MAOI is stopped
Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the tetrabenazine
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the antiarrhythmic, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and testing of the plasma concentrations; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the antiarrhythmic during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ciprofloxacin.

Overdose of theophylline due to decrease of its hepatic elimination, more particularly dangerous with children
Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the clearance of the theophylline)

Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the theophylline)

Increase of the risk of hemorrhage

INTERACTION.COMMENT: An increase of the dosage of the tiagabine can prove necessary in cases when it is administered with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of drop in blood pressure, paroxystic hypertension, hyperthermia, convulsions, death
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the tibolone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to addition of the platelet aggregation activities
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --except for validated indications for this combination in acute coronary syndromes.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort, with decrease of its therapeutic effect.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the therapy with ombitasvir+paritaprevir
Doubling of the plasma concentrations of the antiagregant, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects, especially hemorrhagic ones
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to addition of the platelet antiagregation action
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase of the dosage of the ciclosporin according to testing of the blood concentrations. Reduction of the dosage if the ticlopidine is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose (inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the plasma clearance of the theophylline).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the ticlopidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of excessive bradycardia (addition of the bradycardia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the undesirable cholinergic effects, especially digestive ones
Risk of lengthening of the motor block, increased in the case of partial deficit of pseudocholinesterase

CLASS.name: GASTRO-INTESTINAL TARGETED MEDICATIONS, ANTACIDS, AND ABSORBANTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the absorption of certain other medications ingested simultaneously
INTERACTION.COMMENT: As a precaution, it is preferable to take these gastrointestinal targeted medications, antacids, and absorbent medications at a different time from any other medication (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

CLASS.name: GASTRO-INTESTINAL TARGETED MEDICATIONS, ANTACIDS, AND ABSORBANTS
SUBSTANCES WITH ABSORPTION REDUCED BY GASTRO-INTESTINAL TARGETED MEDICATIONS, ANTACIDS, AND ABSORBANTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the absorption of these substances
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the medications, antacids, or absorbants at a different time from these substances (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the topiramate with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the toprimate during the treatment with the carbamazepine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of topiramate >= 200 mg/day: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of estrogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier type, should be used.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of topiramate >=200mg/day: increase of the the plasma concentrations of lithium that can reach toxic levels, with signs of overdose of lithium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring. Adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the topiramate with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the oxcarbazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the topiramate during the treatment with the oxcarbazepine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hyperammonemia, with increased risk of encephalopathy
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring.

CLASS.name: TORSADES DE POINTES INDUCING MEDICATIONS (EXCEPT ANTIPARASITICS, NEUROLEPTICS, METHADONE)
SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --for erythromycin and vincamine, only the forms administered by IV route are affected by this interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the trabectedine by the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together is necessary, clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the trabectedine during the length of the treatment with the itraconazole

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT RISK WHEN WITHDRAWING FROM TOBACCO

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of overdose when replacing tobacco by the substitution treatment
Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the tramadol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tramadol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion. In addition, risk of convulsions due to addition of the effects of the two medications
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Risk of appearance of convulsions and/or a serotonin syndrome
Decrease of the intensity and of the duration of the analgesic effect of the tramadol and risk of decrease of the antiemitic effect of the ondansetron
Risk of appearance of convulsions and/or of a serotonin syndrome
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the DM1, a component of the trastuzumab emtansine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and the dose of the medication derived from ergot of rye, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the thiclabendazole and the ergotamine, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the torsade inducing medication)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the torsade inducing medication)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and the dose of the torsade inducing medication, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the trimethoprim (alone or in combination) by oral route: increase of the creatinemia with possible decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
With trimethoprime (alone or in combination) by IV route: the decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin can be very large with possible loss of all immunosuppressant capacity
Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate (decrease of its renal excretion as well as inhibition of the dihydrofolate reductase).
Megaloblastic anemia, more particularly with strong doses of the two products (deficit of folic acid due to the combination of the two 2-4 diaminopyrimidines)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular CBC and addition of a treatment with folic acid (regular IM injections).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the trimethoprim

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 6 to 24 hours, depending on the triptan, between taking it and the ergot alkaloid.

Risk of increase of hemorrhagic events when one oral anticoagulant is replaced with another.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take into account the half-life of the oral anticoagulant and observe, if the situation requires, a delay for clearance before the start of treatment with another. Be sure to inform the patient.

Increase of the oral anticoagulant's risk of hemorrhage (irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the non-steroidal anti-inflammatories)

INTERACTION.COMMENT: When administering substances from these groups together is justified, strengthen monitoring: if the situation requires, with the vitamin K antagonists, biological monitoring on the 8th day, then every two weeks after that during the corticotherapy and after it is stopped.

Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil, with increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, due to increase of its plasma concentrations by the verapamil

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident.

Excessive bradycardia and atrioventricular block due to increase of the effects of the digoxin on autoregulation and conduction and due to decrease of the renal and extrarenal elimination of the digoxin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the doxorubicin due to increase of its plasma concentrations

Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment by the calcium channel blocker with the lowest recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the verapamil.
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the erythromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another opioid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the inducer: the consequences are particularly great with patients who have Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of organ transplants
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, dosage adjustment during the treatment with carbamazepine and after it is stopped.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, dosage adjustment during the treatment with the carbamazepine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of clinically low thyroid in patients with hypothyroidism, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and of the T4
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of these substances together and after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metronidazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of metronidazole during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentration of the midazolam by the anticonvulsant

Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the inducer: the consequences are particularly great in patients with Addisons disease treated with the hydrocortisone and in the case of transplants.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the montelukast due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antiasthmatic during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the calcium channel blocker during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease (up to two thirds) of the concentrations of perampanel
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the posaconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If possible, plasma dosages of the posaconazole and possible adjustment of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantel, with risk of failure of the treatment due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the hypersensitivity reactions (hypereosinophilia, rash), due to increase of the metabolism of the procarbazine by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafenone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during its administration with the inducer and after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness.
Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the quinine during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of rivaroxaban, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the anticonvulsant, with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the stiripentol.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and plasma dosage, when that is possible, of the anticonvulsant taken with the stiripentol and possible adjustment of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the theophylline due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, monitoring of the theophyllinemia. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tiagabine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: An increase of the dosage of tiagabine can prove necessary when it is administered with an anticonvulsant enzyme inducer

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to increase of its hepatic metabolsim by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of vitamin D more marked than in the absence of the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Concentration dosage of vitamin D and supplementation if necessary

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
-for carbamazipine, phenobarbital, primidone: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
For phenytoin, fosphenytoin:
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin, for one thing; and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole for another thing
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the clarithromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical and biological monitoring. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cobicistat
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical and biological monitoring. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Risk of increase of the pulmonary toxicity of the mitomycin and of the vinca alkaloids
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the posaconazole
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the telithromycin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib
In case of intake of 10,000 IU/day and more: risk of intracranial hypertension
Risk of symptoms evocative of hypervitaminosis A
Decrease of the concentrations of vitamin D more noticeable than in the absence of the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Concentration dosage of vitamin D and supplementation if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the absorption of the vitamin D
Decrease of the concentrations of vitamin D more noticeable than in the absence of treatment with the rifampacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Concentration dosage of vitamin D and supplementation if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, due to possible decrease of the metabolism of the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the amiodarone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
--for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone:
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
--for phenytoin, fosphenytoin:
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin, for one thing; and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole, for another.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone

INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with voriconazole and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route:
increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome even of adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamthasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the efavirenz
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole and of the efavirenz during the administration of the two together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the glipizide at the origin of potentially severe hypoglycemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during and after the treatment with voriconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the everolimus, the sirolimus, and the temsirolimus

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large reduction of the concentrations of the antifungal due to increase of its metabolism by the ritonavir, with risk of failure of the treatment
Significant reduction of the concentrations of voriconazole, with risk of loss of its therapeutic effect
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole during the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifabutin for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin for another.

Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects

increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the zinc by the calcium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the calcium salts at a different time from the zinc (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the zinc by the iron
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the zinc (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the fluoroquinlones (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decease of the digestive absorption of the strontium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the strontium at a different time from the zinc salts (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the anticonvulsant
.
Slight increase of the sedative effect of the zolpidem

.

Increase of hemorrhagic events

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For anti-inflammatory dosages of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500mg by dose and/or <3g per day):
Acute renal insufficiency with dehydrated patients, due to decrease of the glomerular filtration following a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage, especially in cases with a previous gastro duodenal ulcer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: - anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1 g per dose and/or >= 3g per day)

With anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 g per day):
increase of the risk of digestive ulceration and hemorrhage

CLASS.name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)

CLASS.name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (PREVENTIVE DOSES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The combination of medications acting at different levels of hemostasis increases the risk of bleeding. Thus, with patients under the age of 65, adding heparin in preventive doses to acetylsalicylic acid, whatever the dosage, must be taken into account by maintaining clinical monitoring and possibly biological monitoring.

DRUG.name: UNFRACTIONATED HEPARIN (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENTS)

CLASS.name: ANTIPARASITICS THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of neuropsychological disorders.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism of the dopaminergic and the neuroleptics. The dopaminergic can cause or aggravate the psychotic disorders. When a treatment with neuroleptics is necessary for a Parkinsons patient treated with dopaminergics, these latter must be decreased progressively until they are stopped (their abrupt discontinuation exposes the patient to a risk of "neuroleptic malignant syndrome" (NMS)).
Decrease of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K antagonist at the beginning of the treatment with the immuno-inhibitor and after it is stopped

Possibly serious medullary insufficiency
Increased risks of serious undesirable effects, due to inhibition of the metabolism of the immunoinhibitor by the ribavirin
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the atazanavir
Risk of deficiency of cyanocobalamin after prolonged treatment (several years), the reduction of gastric acidity by these medications can diminish the digestive absorption of vitamin B12

CLASS.name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In cases of obstetrical surgery, increased uterine inertia with risk of hemorrhage; furthermore serious ventricular arrhythmias, due to increase of the cardiac reactivity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Interrupt treatment with the beta-2 agonist if the anesthesia must be done with halothane

CLASS.name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce blood and urine monitoring

CLASS.name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce blood and urine monitoring. Possibly change to insulin, if the situation requires.

CLASS.name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

CLASS.name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and electrical conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reduction of the compensatory cardiovascular reactions by the beta-blocking agents. The beta-adrenergic inhibition can be elevated during the surgical procedure by the beta-mimetics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: As a general rule, do not stop the treatment with the beta-blocking agent and, in any case, avoid stopping it abruptly. Inform the anesthesiologist of this treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of blood pressure in cases of sudden discontinuation of the treatment with the central hypertensive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid stopping the treatment with the central antihypertensive abruptly. Clinical monitoring

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reduction of the antihypertensive effect (inhibition of the vasodilator prostaglandins by the non steroidal anti-inflammatories)

Hypotension, heart failure in patients with latent or uncontrolled cardiac insufficiency (addition of the negative inotropic effects). The beta-blocking agent can furthermore minimize the sympathetic reflex reaction brought into play in the case of excessive hemodynamic repercussion
Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and heart failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The administration of these medications together should only be done under clinical monitoring and strict EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dipyridamole by injection: increase of the antihypertensive effect
All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With lidocaine administered by IV route: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine during the administration of the substances together and after the beta-blocking agent is stopped. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, especially at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and heart failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The administration of these medications together should only be undertaken under strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reduction of the compensatory cardiovascular reactions by the beta-blocking agents. The beta-adrenergic inhibition can be elevated by the beta-stimulants during the surgery
INTERACTION.COMMENT: As a general rule, do not stop the treatment with the beta blocking agent and, in any case, avoid stopping it abruptly. Inform the anesthesiologist of this treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure
Risk of excessive bradycardia (addition of the bradycardia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Vasodilator effect and risk of hypotension, especially orthostatic (additive effect)
Central decrease of the sympathetic tone and vasodilator effect of the central antihypertensives, dangerous in cases of heart failure treated with a beta-blocking agent and vasodilator
Difficulties of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest) and of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction

Hypotension, heart failure in patients with latent or uncontrolled cardiac insufficiency (negative iotropic effect of the dihydropyridines in vitro more or less marked and susceptible of adding to the negative inotropic effects of the beta-blocking agents). The presence of a beta-blocking treatment can furthermore minimize the sympathetic reflex reaction put into play in cases of excessive hemodynamic repercussion
Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure, disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest), and disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction
All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the beginning of treatment, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the start of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure
Vasodilator effect and risk of hypotension, especially orthostatic (additive effect)

CLASS.name: SUBSTANCES THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, especially at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure, disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest) and disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction
For calcium salts administered via oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the bisphosphonates
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the calcium salts and antacids at a different time from the bisphosphonates (from 30 minutes minimum to more than 2 hours apart, if possible, depending on the bisphosphonate).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For the iron salts administered via oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the bisphosphonates
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the bisphosphonates (from 30 minutes minimum to more than 2 hours apart, if possible, depending on the bisphosphonate).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of pulmonary toxicity
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of them together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of atorvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached with this dosage, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase by more than double of the concentrations of drosperinone when taken with the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a contraceptive with another progestin, especially in cases of hyperkalemia

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration with the boceprevir.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Aside from the combination with ethinylestradiol (0.035mg)/noresthisterone (1mg), risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the time these medications are taken together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant (substantial for the ciclosporin, extremely large for the tacrolimus)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of renal function, and adjustment of its dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the boceprevir and of the lopinavir (or darunavir or fosamprenavir), with risk of therapeutic failure
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone, with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Aside from the combination with ethinylestradiol (0.035mg)/noresthisterone (1mg), risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the time these medications are taken together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of treatment with the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type due to decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the tenefovir alafenamide by decrease of its intracellular activity by the boceprevir
Decrease of the concentrations of the cytotoxic due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially neurological, of the bortezomib due to decrease of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the bortezomib during the length of the treatment with the enzymatic inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin and increase of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cyproterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In its indications such as anti-androgen, clinical monitoring and if possible adjustment of the dosage of the cyproterone during the administration with the bosentan and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the length of time the two substances are administered together and for a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduced effectiveness of the glibenclamide due to decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of the inducer effect of the bosentan. Furthermore, cases of hepotoxicity have been reported with these two substances administered together.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the glycemia, adjustment of the treatment if needed, and monitoring of the hepatic biological constants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of the undesirable effects of the bosantan, especially hepatic attacks, due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring during the administration of these together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an additional or alternative reliable method of contraception during the time these substances are administered together and one cycle following

CLASS.name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the progestogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the bosentan and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease, large for the rifampicin, of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Risk of increase of the effects of the botulinum toxin with the aminoglycosides (by extrapolation from the effects observed during the course of the botulism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Strengthening of the effects, both cytostatic and undesirable, of the fluorouracil.
